title: How To Install APK Files from a PC on Android

steps.title: Open your Android’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your Android’s Settings. It’s the icon typically found in the app drawer or atop the notifications panel. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . You will need to allow certain apps on your phone to download from unknown sources. Older versions of Android would house the setting you need in the "Security" section, but as of Android Oreo, you should navigate to "Apps" instead.

steps.title: Tap Special app access.
steps.content: Tap Special app access . It is the option at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap Install unknown apps.
steps.content: Tap Install unknown apps . The Special app access page will include several different options. [2] X Research source Find Install unknown apps in the bottom third of the menu.

steps.title: Select a file manager app.
steps.content: Select a file manager app. Only select apps will appear on this next page. You will see Chrome, or a similar web browser, as well as any file storage/sharing apps like Google Drive or Gmail. You will also see your phone's default file manager app - Files by Google on a Google Pixel or Samsung My Files on a Samsung device. Select your file manager to continue. [3] X Research source While your phone's default file manager may be sufficient for this process, we recommend downloading a third-party file manager from the Google Play Store. These apps tend to be more comprehensive and intuitive when it comes to retrieving your files at a later point. ES File Explorer, for example, can help you easily access your Android's root files , which may prove helpful if any future issues arise.

steps.title: Slide the “Allow from this source” switch to the position.
steps.content: Slide the “Allow from this source” switch to the position. With this switch on, your file manager can now install unknown apps (i.e. APKs). Feel free to turn this switch on for any other apps listed on the previous page. You only need the file manager in order to install APK files from a PC, but allowing Chrome to install from unknown sources could make your future efforts to install APKs even easier!

steps.title: Find an APK file online.
steps.content: Find an APK file online. There are several popular APK repositories online. APK Mirror might be a good place to start.

steps.title: Download an APK file to your PC.
steps.content: Download an APK file to your PC. You can save it to the desktop or any other folder on your computer.

steps.title: Connect your Android to the PC using a USB cable.
steps.content: Connect your Android to the PC using a USB cable. If you don’t have the cable that came with your Android, you can use any compatible cable. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the USB for… notification on your Android.
steps.content: Tap the USB for… notification on your Android. A list of options will appear. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Transfer files on your Android.
steps.content: Tap Transfer files on your Android. The option may also be referred to as Media Transfer Protocol, or MTP for short.

steps.title: Navigate to the APK file on the computer.
steps.content: Navigate to the APK file on the computer. To do this, open the folder where you downloaded the file.

steps.title: Right-click the APK file and select Show more options.
steps.content: Right-click the APK file and select Show more options . The latest iterations of Windows use a different pop-up menu than what you may be used to in the past. To find the file sharing option we need, select Show more options at the bottom of the pop-up.

steps.title: Hover over Send to and select your Android.
steps.content: Hover over Send to and select your Android. Hovering your mouse over the Send to option will open an additional pop-up menu. As long as your Android is connected to your PC properly, you should see it listed at the bottom of this menu. Click it, and the APK file will transfer to your Android.

steps.title: Open your Android’s file manager.
steps.content: Open your Android’s file manager. Make sure it is the same file manager app you allowed permissions for earlier.

steps.title: Locate the APK file.
steps.content: Locate the APK file. It will likely be in your Downloads folder, but a good file manager app will also identify your New files , making it easier to find the APK quickly. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the APK file.
steps.content: Tap the APK file. A confirmation message will appear, asking if you really want to install the file. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap INSTALL.
steps.content: Tap INSTALL . It’s at the bottom-right corner of the screen. The app will now install on your Android. When the installation is complete, a confirmation message will appear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap DONE.
steps.content: Tap DONE . Your new app is now ready to use.
